data.description:
Hey, soldier, listen up! There's no time to repeat this. The T12 virus has broken containment at the Horizon research station. All the researchers have become walking corpses. The virus is localized for now, but it could break out and cause a disaster at any moment. You're going to walk into that hellhole and cleanse the station. Don't try to save bullets - kill every last zombie.

The station's corridors are full of these creatures. It's a good thing you have a recoilless machine gun. Mop up and come home. Over and out.

Gameplay:

-Realistic, dark graphics: In the Horizon station’s corridors, there is no sun or naive hopefulness. But there are plenty of rotting zombies, dark corridors and bloodstains.
- The game is in the running for the title of Most Realistic Shooter on standalone VR platforms. It’s a great combination of terror and difficulty.
- 10 different weapon types.
- Two different full-fledged game modes: Campaign and Arcade.
- Co-op multiplayer.
- VoIP, avatars.

changelog.change_log: The Horizon Lab goes back to its everyday life. The interior of the rooms has got back to its usual form.

Dream Dev Studio wishes everyone a Merry Christmas and Happy New Year!

Thank you all so much for your feedback and support.

Now it’s time to present the holiday update!

The winter is upon us in Horizon Lab, so now there are snowmen, fairy lights and Christmas trees out there.

And what about zombies? Well, zombies stayed – they turned out to be cold-enduring.

Have a nice playing time!

- Game scene improvement in Campaign Mode;
- Bug fix
- bug fix with elevator (scene 2) in Normal Mode

Happy Halloween!

- Scary Mode added in Campaign.
- Lots of minor but significant game improvements.

Major multiplayer updates!
 
- invite friends to play the game (Oculus Room)
- avatar support (on Oculus Go, Samsung S8 and higher) 
- detailed online statistics added in-game 
- voice chat support (VoIP) 
- increased playing time (+2 waves) 
- share ammo between players 
- improved graphics and effects 
- bug fixes

Thank you for playing Death Horizon. We can't express how grateful we are for all the comments and ideas we've got from everyone.

What’s new in V.1.1 :

• 3 new difficulty levels have been added.
• The ability to switch guns has been added. Now players can use whatever their heart desires.
• A new comfort level for in-game movement (teleportation) has been added for players sensitive to VR.

Got an idea on how to improve the game?
Don’t hesitate to let us know in the comments or write us info@dream-dev.com.
